detaileddescription.para: Note: it is important that ISO is 0

briefdescription.para: Typedef for endpoint type.
Typedef for endpoint identifiers.

memberdef.argsstring: (chanend c_epOut[], int noEpOut, chanend c_epIn[], int noEpIn, NULLABLE_RESOURCE(chanend, c_sof), XUD_EpType epTypeTableOut[], XUD_EpType epTypeTableIn[], NULLABLE_RESOURCE(out port, p_usb_rst), NULLABLE_RESOURCE(clock, clk), unsigned rstMask, XUD_BusSpeed_t desiredSpeed, XUD_PwrConfig pwrConfig)
memberdef.name: XUD_Manager

briefdescription.para: This performs the low-level USB I/O operations.

detaileddescription.para: Note that this needs to run in a thread with at least 80 MIPS worst case execution speed.

parameterdescription.para: An array of channel ends, one channel end per output endpoint (USB OUT transaction); this includes a channel to obtain requests on Endpoint 0.
The number of output endpoints, should be at least 1 (for Endpoint 0).
An array of channel ends, one channel end per input endpoint (USB IN transaction); this includes a channel to respond to requests on Endpoint 0.
The number of input endpoints, should be at least 1 (for Endpoint 0).

A channel to receive SOF tokens on. This channel must be connected to a process that can receive a token once every 125 ms. If tokens are not read, the USB layer will lock up. If no SOF tokens are required BACK___TICKBACK___TICKnullBACK___TICKBACK___TICK should be used for this parameter.
See BACK___TICKBACK___TICKepTypeTableInBACK___TICKBACK___TICK.

This and BACK___TICKBACK___TICKepTypeTableOutBACK___TICKBACK___TICK are two arrays indicating the type of the endpoint. Legal types include: BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_EPTYPE_CTLBACK___TICKBACK___TICK (Endpoint 0), BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_EPTYPE_BULBACK___TICKBACK___TICK (Bulk endpoint), BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_EPTYPE_ISOBACK___TICKBACK___TICK (Isochronous endpoint), BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_EPTYPE_INTBACK___TICKBACK___TICK (Interrupt endpoint), BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_EPTYPE_DISBACK___TICKBACK___TICK (Endpoint not used). The first array contains the endpoint types for each of the OUT endpoints, the second array contains the endpoint types for each of the IN endpoints.
The port to used to connect to an external phy reset line. Should be BACK___TICKBACK___TICKnullBACK___TICKBACK___TICK for U-Series.
The clock block to use for the p_usb_rst port - this should not be clock block 0. Should be BACK___TICKBACK___TICKnullBACK___TICKBACK___TICK for U-Series.

The mask to use when taking an external phy into/out of reset. The mask is ORed into the port to disable reset, and unset when deasserting reset. Use '-1' as a default mask if this port is not shared.

This parameter specifies what speed the device will attempt to run at i.e. full-speed (ie 12Mbps) or high-speed (480Mbps) if supported by the host. Pass BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_SPEED_HSBACK___TICKBACK___TICK if high-speed is desired or BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_SPEED_FSBACK___TICKBACK___TICK if not. Low speed USB is not supported by XUD.

Specifies whether the device is bus or self-powered. When self-powered the XUD will monitor the VBUS line for host disconnections. This is required for compliance reasons. Valid values are XUD_PWR_SELF and XUD_PWR_BUS.

memberdef.argsstring: (XUD_ep ep_out, unsigned char buffer[], REFERENCE_PARAM(unsigned, length))
memberdef.name: XUD_GetBuffer

briefdescription.para: This function must be called by a thread that deals with an OUT endpoint.

detaileddescription.para:
When the host sends data, the low-level driver will fill the buffer. It pauses until data is available.
ep_out
The OUT endpoint identifier (created by BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_InitEPBACK___TICKBACK___TICK).
buffer
The buffer in which to store data received from the host. The buffer is assumed to be word aligned.
length
The number of bytes written to the buffer
XUD_RES_OKAY on success, for errors see BACK___TICKBACK___TICKStatus ReportingBACK___TICKBACK___TICK_.

memberdef.argsstring: (XUD_ep ep_out, unsigned char buffer[], REFERENCE_PARAM(unsigned, length))
memberdef.name: XUD_GetSetupBuffer

briefdescription.para: Request setup data from usb buffer for a specific endpoint, pauses until data is available.

parameterdescription.para: The OUT endpoint identifier (created by BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_InitEPBACK___TICKBACK___TICK).
A char buffer passed by ref into which data is returned.
Length of the buffer received (expect 8 bytes)

simplesect.para: XUD_RES_OKAY on success, for errors see BACK___TICKBACK___TICKStatus ReportingBACK___TICKBACK___TICK_.

memberdef.argsstring: (XUD_ep ep_in, unsigned char buffer[], unsigned datalength)
memberdef.name: XUD_SetBuffer

briefdescription.para: This function must be called by a thread that deals with an IN endpoint.

detaileddescription.para:
When the host asks for data, the low-level driver will transmit the buffer to the host.
ep_in
The endpoint identifier (created by BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_InitEpBACK___TICKBACK___TICK).
buffer
The buffer of data to transmit to the host.
datalength
The number of bytes in the buffer.
XUD_RES_OKAY on success, for errors see BACK___TICKBACK___TICKStatus ReportingBACK___TICKBACK___TICK_.

memberdef.argsstring: (XUD_ep ep_in, unsigned char buffer[], unsigned datalength, unsigned epMax)
memberdef.name: XUD_SetBuffer_EpMax

briefdescription.para: Similar to XUD_SetBuffer but breaks up data transfers into smaller packets.

detaileddescription.para:
This function must be called by a thread that deals with an IN endpoint. When the host asks for data, the low-level driver will transmit the buffer to the host.
ep_in
The IN endpoint identifier (created by BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_InitEpBACK___TICKBACK___TICK).
buffer
The buffer of data to transmit to the host.
datalength
The number of bytes in the buffer.
epMax
The maximum packet size in bytes.
XUD_RES_OKAY on success, for errors see BACK___TICKBACK___TICKStatus ReportingBACK___TICKBACK___TICK_.

memberdef.argsstring: (XUD_ep ep_out, XUD_ep ep_in, unsigned char buffer[], unsigned length, unsigned requested)
memberdef.name: XUD_DoGetRequest

briefdescription.para: Performs a combined BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_SetBufferBACK___TICKBACK___TICK and BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_GetBufferBACK___TICKBACK___TICK.

detaileddescription.para: It transmits the buffer of the given length over the BACK___TICKBACK___TICKep_inBACK___TICKBACK___TICK endpoint to answer an IN request, and then waits for a 0 length Status OUT transaction on BACK___TICKBACK___TICKep_outBACK___TICKBACK___TICK. This function is normally called to handle Get control requests to Endpoint 0.

parameterdescription.para: The endpoint identifier that handles Endpoint 0 OUT data in the XUD manager.
The endpoint identifier that handles Endpoint 0 IN data in the XUD manager.
The data to send in response to the IN transaction. Note that this data is chopped up in fragments of at most 64 bytes.
Length of data to be sent.
The length that the host requested, (Typically pass the value BACK___TICKBACK___TICKwLengthBACK___TICKBACK___TICK).

simplesect.para: XUD_RES_OKAY on success, for errors see BACK___TICKBACK___TICKStatus ReportingBACK___TICKBACK___TICK_

briefdescription.para: This function sends an empty packet back on the next IN request with PID1.

detaileddescription.para:
It is normally used by Endpoint 0 to acknowledge success of a control transfer.
ep_in
The Endpoint 0 IN identifier to the XUD manager.
XUD_RES_OKAY on success, for errors see BACK___TICKBACK___TICKStatus ReportingBACK___TICKBACK___TICK_.

briefdescription.para: Sets the device's address.

detaileddescription.para:
This function must be called by Endpoint 0 once a BACK___TICKBACK___TICKsetDeviceAddressBACK___TICKBACK___TICK request is made by the host.
addr
New device address.
Must be run on USB core

briefdescription.para: This function will complete a reset on an endpoint.

detaileddescription.para:
Can take one or two BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_epBACK___TICKBACK___TICK as parameters (the second parameter can be set to BACK___TICKBACK___TICKnullBACK___TICKBACK___TICK). The return value should be inspected to find the new bus-speed. In Endpoint 0 typically two endpoints are reset (IN and OUT). In other endpoints BACK___TICKBACK___TICKnullBACK___TICKBACK___TICK can be passed as the second parameter.
one
IN or OUT endpoint identifier to perform the reset on.
two
Optional second IN or OUT endpoint structure to perform a reset on.
Either BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_SPEED_HSBACK___TICKBACK___TICK - the host has accepted that this device can execute at high speed, or BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_SPEED_FSBACK___TICKBACK___TICK - the device is runnig at full speed.

briefdescription.para: Initialises an XUD_ep.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint channel to be connected to the XUD library.

briefdescription.para: Mark an endpoint as STALL based on its EP address.

detaileddescription.para:
Cleared automatically if a SETUP received on the endpoint. Note: the IN bit of the endpoint address is used.
epNum
Endpoint number.
Must be run on same tile as XUD core

briefdescription.para: Mark an endpoint as NOT STALLed based on its EP address.

detaileddescription.para:
Note: the IN bit of the endpoint address is used.
epNum
Endpoint number.
Must be run on same tile as XUD core

briefdescription.para: Mark an endpoint as STALLed.

detaileddescription.para:
It is cleared automatically if a SETUP received on the endpoint.
ep
XUD_ep type.
Must be run on same tile as XUD core

briefdescription.para: Mark an endpoint as NOT STALLed.

parameterdescription.para: XUD_ep type.

simplesect.para: Must be run on same tile as XUD core

briefdescription.para: Reset an Endpoints state including data PID toggle Note: the IN bit of the endpoint address is used.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint number (including IN bit)

simplesect.para: Must be run on same tile as XUD core

briefdescription.para: Enable a specific USB test mode in XUD.

parameterdescription.para: XUD_ep type (must be endpoint 0 in or out)
The desired test-mode

simplesect.para: Must be run on same tile as XUD core

memberdef.name: XUD_SetData

briefdescription.para: Gives a data buffer to XUD from transmission to the host.

parameterdescription.para: The IN endpoint identifier.
The packet buffer to send data from.
The length of the packet to send (in bytes).
The start index of the packet in the buffer (typically 0).
No longer used, value ignored

simplesect.para: XUD_RES_OKAY on success, for errors see BACK___TICKBACK___TICKStatus ReportingBACK___TICKBACK___TICK.

briefdescription.para: Marks an OUT endpoint as ready to receive data.

parameterdescription.para: The OUT endpoint identifier (created by BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_InitEpBACK___TICKBACK___TICK).
The buffer in which to store data received from the host. The buffer is assumed to be word aligned.

simplesect.para: XUD_RES_OKAY on success, for errors see BACK___TICKBACK___TICKStatus ReportingBACK___TICKBACK___TICK.

briefdescription.para: Marks an OUT endpoint as ready to receive data.

parameterdescription.para: The OUT endpoint identifier (created by BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_InitEpBACK___TICKBACK___TICK).
The address of the buffer in which to store data received from the host. The buffer is assumed to be word aligned.

simplesect.para: XUD_RES_OKAY on success, for errors see BACK___TICKBACK___TICKStatus ReportingBACK___TICKBACK___TICK.

briefdescription.para: Marks an IN endpoint as ready to transmit data.

parameterdescription.para: The IN endpoint identifier (created by BACK___TICKBACK___TICKXUD_InitEpBACK___TICKBACK___TICK).
The address of the buffer to transmit to the host. The buffer is assumed be word aligned.
The length of the data to transmit.

simplesect.para: XUD_RES_OKAY on success, for errors see BACK___TICKBACK___TICKStatus ReportingBACK___TICKBACK___TICK.

The buffer to transmit to the host. The buffer is assumed be word aligned.
The length of the data to transmit.

simplesect.para: XUD_RES_OKAY on success, for errors see BACK___TICKBACK___TICKStatus ReportingBACK___TICKBACK___TICK.

Passed by reference. The number of bytes written to the buffer (that was passed into XUD_SetReady_Out())
XUD_Result_t passed by reference. XUD_RES_OKAY on success, for errors see BACK___TICKBACK___TICKStatus ReportingBACK___TICKBACK___TICK.
